description.plain:
Megan Jovon Ruth Pete (b. February 15, 1995), best known by her stage name Megan Thee Stallion, and also known by her alter-ego names Tina Snow and Hot Girl Meg is a rapper from Houston, Texas.

Meg grew up the daughter of rapper Holly-Wood (Holly Thomas), and listened to Southern rap staples like Three 6 Mafia and UGK from an early age. By 14 years old, this had largely inspired her to start writing her own raps, and she then went on to establish her presence around the Houston rap circuit by battling and beating opponents in local freestyle competitions.

In the present: sexually explicit yet empowering lyrics combined with effortless flows have become Megan’s signature sound—as she strives to emulate her favorite parts of her male rapper influences (such as Pimp C and Biggie Smalls) but in a female version.

  


In November 2018, Meg signed with 300 Entertainment, making her the first female artist on the label. However, she would later end up suing 300 as a result of them blocking her from releasing music. After this, Roc Nation began managing Meg, which boosted her journey to mainstream superstardom that had already begun on the social media app TikTok with her song “Savage.”
The subsequent Beyoncé-assisted “Savage Remix” then helped Meg attain her first number one single on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in May 2020.

Unfortunately, two months on, Megan sustained gunshot wounds and had to undergo surgery to remove bullet fragments from her feet. She later alleged it was musician and acquaintance Tory Lanez that fired the gun—causing a messy, high-profile public controversy to transpire.
Not letting the incident hold her back, the career-defining hit “WAP” that Meg shared with fellow femcee Cardi B was released in August, also reaching number one and making history in the process.

Some months after, Megan’s debut album Good News dropped, addressing some of 2020’s drama and highlighting her growth as an artist from the four EP’s that came before it.

  


On March 14, 2021, at her first ever Grammy Awards ceremony—Megan won three categories. These were Best New Artist, Best Rap Song, and Best Rap Performance.
At the end of the same year, she released her first ever compilation album and graduated from Texas Southern University, earning a bachelor of science degree in health administration.

Then, in 2022, Megan used her 27th birthday to launch the Pete & Thomas Foundation—a non-profit organization named after her late parents and designed to give back to people in need.

Megan Jovon Ruth Pete (b. February 15, 1995), best known by her stage name Megan Thee Stallion, and also known by her alter-ego names Tina Snow and Hot Girl Meg is a rapper from Houston, Texas.

Meg grew up the daughter of rapper Holly-Wood (Holly Thomas), and listened to Southern rap staples like Three 6 Mafia and UGK from an early age. By 14 years old, this had largely inspired her to start writing her own raps, and she then went on to establish her presence around the Houston rap circuit by battling and beating opponents in local freestyle competitions.

In the present: sexually explicit yet empowering lyrics combined with effortless flows have become Megan’s signature sound—as she strives to emulate her favorite parts of her male rapper influences (such as Pimp C and Biggie Smalls) but in a female version.

  


In November 2018, Meg signed with 300 Entertainment, making her the first female artist on the label. However, she would later end up suing 300 as a result of them blocking her from releasing music. After this, Roc Nation began managing Meg, which boosted her journey to mainstream superstardom that had already begun on the social media app TikTok with her song “Savage.”
The subsequent Beyoncé-assisted “Savage Remix” then helped Meg attain her first number one single on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in May 2020.

Unfortunately, two months on, Megan sustained gunshot wounds and had to undergo surgery to remove bullet fragments from her feet. She later alleged it was musician and acquaintance Tory Lanez that fired the gun—causing a messy, high-profile public controversy to transpire.
Not letting the incident hold her back, the career-defining hit “WAP” that Meg shared with fellow femcee Cardi B was released in August, also reaching number one and making history in the process.

Some months after, Megan’s debut album Good News dropped, addressing some of 2020’s drama and highlighting her growth as an artist from the four EP’s that came before it.

  


On March 14, 2021, at her first ever Grammy Awards ceremony—Megan won three categories. These were Best New Artist, Best Rap Song, and Best Rap Performance.
At the end of the same year, she released her first ever compilation album and graduated from Texas Southern University, earning a bachelor of science degree in health administration.

Then, in 2022, Megan used her 27th birthday to launch the Pete & Thomas Foundation—a non-profit organization named after her late parents and designed to give back to people in need.

songs.full_title: Savage Remix by Megan Thee Stallion (Ft. Beyoncé)
songs.title: Savage Remix

description.plain:
On the remix to Megan Thee Stallion’s hot single “Savage,” Meg teams up with fellow Houston native Beyoncé for the first time. The two first met at a New Year’s Eve party in December 2019:



On the track, Megan spits an entirely new verse, while Beyoncé name-drops various staples of the 2020 zeitgeist, referencing everything from the phrase “Demon Time” to TikTok and OnlyFans. It features two of them trading bars with additional backing vocals by Beyoncé.

songs.full_title: Cash Shit by Megan Thee Stallion (Ft. DaBaby)
songs.title: Cash Shit

description.plain:
Released on Megan Thee Stallion’s debut mixtape Fever, the hit “Cash Shit” is the first of the numerous collaborations between Megan and Charlotte, North Carolina rapper Dababy.

Over a very simple beat provided by LilJuMadeDaBeat, the two artists elaborate on—as suggested by the title—their money: where they got it from and how they spend it.

songs.embed_content: Read “Cash Shit” by Megan Thee Stallion on Genius

songs.title: Savage

description.plain:
Megan Thee Stallion decisively manifests herself as a “savage” on the second track from her third EP Suga, released on March 6, 2020. With plenty of references to her older songs and uplifting lyricism, it’s clear that Megan will indeed “forever be that bitch.”

Four days after Suga was released, choreographer Keara Wilson created an original dance to the track on TikTok, a popular video-sharing social media network. In the following days, the dance quickly became viral, even to the point of Megan shouting-out various TikTok creators putting their own spin to the dance.

The “Savage Remix” featuring Beyoncé was released on April 29, 2020 and an animated music video for the original version followed on May 21, 2020.

In the following days, the dance quickly became viral, even to the point of Megan shouting-out various TikTok creators putting their own spin to the dance.
